Author: PTYX#6840
Content: The reality is that people don't pay for dinner with gold, oil, or bitcoins. They use local currencies.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: To bring btc or any other cryptocurrency for that matter to such scale will take many many more years.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Systems that seamlessly interact between the local currencies and the cryptocurrencies could be what is needed. That could be a reason why people are now hailing stablecoin as the "next" thing.

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content:
`with gold, oil, or bitcoins. They use local currencies.`
That comparison is exactly why I feel as I do about BTC
The wp notion *was* for it to be "electronic cash" (something that couldn't even be compared to "oil or gold")
Core has a different vision, and as long as "oil and gold" is "at the top", then that's how __all__ crypto will be "pigeon-holed"

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content:
`Systems that seamlessly interact between the local currencies and the cryptocurrencies could be what is needed. `
That, quite literally, defeats the entire point

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: I don't expect a decentralized cryptocurrency to take over any national currency in totality. If you try to go head on against the biggest institutions in the world you'll find yourself in a world of hurt and could meet even more resistance.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: By building systems that interact with the two spheres and to a certain degree complies with established laws then you introduce a new model without as much resistance.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Plus, there is also a technological leap when using cryptocurrency.

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content:
@PTYX by "failed excuse" I mean that it's because it fails on an epic level due to being nothing more than an imaginary excuse
Lack of adoption isn't because it's "hard" or much of anything needs to be "learned"
Lack of adoption is because:
\* We, in the community, portray it as "hard to learn" even when it's not (like I said, it's harder to make a call on an iPhone than it is to make a tx)
\* Even still, BTC is "god" and all "average people" know of it is "dark web", "criminals", and "Silk Road" (usually in that order)
\* We refute silly claims like the one that started this convo in obscure channels like this and not using the same megaphone that detractors use
